# Department : Surgical Gastroenterology Discharge Summary

| CR No.: 239212502577971        | Name: Pramod Mevadha                                 | Age/Gender: 34 Yr/M                  |
|--------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
| Admission No.: 239212025052548 | Department Unit: Surgical Gastroenterology (Surgical | Consultant/Faculty: Dr Vishal Gupta  |
|                                | Gastroenterology)                                    |                                      |
| Ward: Gastro Surgery Ward      | Room/Bed: Gastro Srg Ward Room/ Bed 4                | Patient Category: Ayushman Bharat    |
| Discharge Type: On request     | Father/Spouse Name: Doulat Singh/-                   | Occupation:                          |
| Contact No.: 7869983514        | Address: Gram Raipur Nayakheda Post Pachama, Raipur  | State/Country Madhya                 |
|                                | Nayakheda, Ash,,,Sehore                              | Pradesh/India                        |
| D.O.A. : 28-Aug-2025 13:45     | D.O.D. : 05-Sep-2025                                 | D.O. Print Report: 05-Sep-2025 14:09 |

# CHIEF COMPLAINTS:

Pain Abdomen x 1 week

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient was apparently alright 1 week back when he developed abdominal pain (upper abdomen, VAS-9/10), sudden in onset, progressive in nature, radiating to back and chest , which is persistent, not relieved with IV Analgesics, not associated with vomiting. Patient consulted elsewhere for these complaints, evaluated with imaging and managed conservatively; since pt did not get symptoms relief, patient consulted in SGE OPD in AIIMS, Bhopal and was admitted for further management. No h/o Vomiting/GI bleed/ Jaundice. H/o Fever on and Off +(documented). Past History: H/o of similar episodes 3 years back , diagnosed to have acute pancreatitis, admitted in outside hospital, managed conservatively and got symptomatic relief. Pt has been asymptomatic since then till current episode. H/O single episode of hemoptysis (suspected hematemesis) 1.5 yrs back. H/o multiple episodes of respiratory Illness since childhood Drug history: Chronic analgesic abuse for 3 years. H/o alcoholic & smoking for 7 years, stopped 2 years back & tobacco chewer for 2-3 yrs & taking actively. No known medical comorbidities (DM/HTN/CAD /Asthma. No past surgical history. No known allergy

CASE SUMMARY: Patient conscious oriented to time,place and person.

No Edema/LN/clubbing/pallor/icterus are present.

PR-60/min BP- 102/68 - mmHg, Spo2- 98% (RA)

P/a- soft, epigastric tenderness present, not distended, No organomegaly, No ascites.

CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating orals, passing flatus and motion, abdomen soft, non tender and hence being discharged in stable condition. Headache and mild pain abdomen present.

## FINAL DIAGNOSIS:

Acute on chronic calcific pancreatitis

Remarks: Ethanol related

Pseudocyst

Splenomegaly

SVT

![](_page_1_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_1_Picture_3.jpeg)

Ascites

| H/O Acute pancreatitis (2019) |
|-------------------------------|
| Kartagener syndrome;          |
| Chronic analgesic abuse       |

Urticaria

Nasal polyp

HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient was admitted in SGE ward for above mentioned complaints. Necessary blood investigations were done (Hb-13, TLC-7220 Plt ��� 2.3L, S.Urea/Creat ��� 8.7/0.8, TB-0.4, DB-0.06, SGOT/SGPT-38/16 ALP-67, TP/ALB- 7.6/3.9, amylase-867, Lipase - 643, Crp-26, Hba1c-4.9). Gastromedicine consultation was sought for UGIE to look for PHTN changes, advised Hba1c, fecal elastase. USG S-P axis done: splenomegaly (15 cm) with hilar collaterals; liver normal (14.9 cm). Portal vein 9.1 mm with PSV 81.1 cm/s; no IHBRD, IVC and hepatic veins normal.��� Pulmonology consultation was sought for ? Bronchiectasis, advised CECT Chest, S.IgE, Sputum analysis, Nebulization with Leuvolin, Syrup Ambroxol. Sputum C/s was reported as sample inadequate. , KOH mount reported No Fungal Elements. USG w/a (1/9/25) revealed f/s/o Chronic pancreatitis with Pseudocyst (3.8 x 6cm) at tail, moderate splenomegaly with borderline Hepatomegaly. De-addiction clinic consultation was sought for Nicotine withdrawal symptoms, advised Nicotine Patch 7mg in morning for 12 hrs. ENT opinion was sought for ? Sinusitis, Reported polypoidal /mulberry changes in nose, advised Nasoclear Nasal Spray. Neurology Consultation was sought i/v/o headache, advised NCCT Brain, T. Amitriptyline, T. Naxdom. Dermatology opinion sought for urticaria secondary to kartagener syndrome. advised tab sod cromoglycate 4mg BD & review in Dermatology OPD. Patient was managed with IVF, IV PPI, IV analgesics, Iv antiemetics, symptomatic & supportive care. During hospital course, patient improved on conservative management with decreased abdominal pain (vas -3/10) except one episode of severe pain, and was advised continued observation however, patient wants discharge on request today due to personal reason . Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating orals, passing flatus and motion, abdomen soft, non tender and hence being discharged in stable condition.

OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: USG W/A(23/08/25,Outside)-LIVER-mildly enlarged,a well defined hypoechoic heterogenous mass lesion 2.1 cm is seen in periportal region with partial degeneration.There is clear fat plane between portal vein and the mass.minimal perihepatic fluid is seen.IMPRESSION;Hypoechoic lobulated lesion in periportal region with partial degeneration,query degenerative nodes.to correlate with mild hepatomegaly with mild perihepatic fluid is seen.to correlate with lab data.

CECT Abdomen(26/08/25,Outside)-IMAGING FINDINGS: Situs inversus:The abdominal and thoracic organs are transposed. The liver is located on the left side, the spleen on the right side, and the cardiac apex is directed to the right, confirming situs inversus. Liver:The liver is mildly enlarged (mild hepatomegaly) but shows homogeneous enhancement. No focal lesion or intrahepatic biliary dilatation is seen.

Spleen and Splenic Vein:The spleen is right-sided and appears normal in size. The splenic vein is occluded, with multiple collateral venous channels noted along the splenic hilum and perigastric region, consistent with collateral circulation due to chronic splenic vein thrombosis.

Pancreas:The pancreas is shrunken and irregular in outline with multiple coarse parenchymal calcifications. The main pancreatic duct is dilated up to 15 mm, consistent with chronic calcific pancreatitis. No peripancreatic fluid collection or acute inflammatory changes are seen.

![](_page_2_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_2_Picture_3.jpeg)

Peritoneum:A small amount of free fluid is seen in the peritoneal cavity, consistent with mild ascites. Pleura:Minimal free fluid is present in the right pleural cavity, consistent with a minimal right pleural effusion. Lung Bases:The lung bases demonstrate multiple mucoid-impacted bronchioles, suggestive of chronic airway disease/bronchiectasis. Other abdominal organs:Gallbladder, adrenal glands, and kidneys are normal. No hydronephrosis, renal calculus, or adrenal lesion.

Urinary bladder and prostate are unremarkable. Bowel loops show normal calibre and enhancement with no evidence of obstruction or perforation.

No significant retroperitoneal, mesenteric, or pelvic lymphadenopathy. Bones: Visualized bony structures show no destructive or sclerotic lesion.

IMPRESSION: CECT ABDOMEN AND PELVIS REVEALS- SITUS INVERSUS WITH COMPLETE TRANSPOSITION OF ABDOMINAL AND THORACIC ORGANS.MILD HEPATOMEGALY.SPLENIC VEIN OCCLUSION WITH MULTIPLE PERISPLENIC AND PERIGASTRIC COLLATERAL VESSELS. CHRONIC CALCIFIC PANCREATITIS WITH MULTIPLE PARENCHYMAL CALCIFICATIONS AND GROSSLY DILATED PANCREATIC DUCT (UP TO 15 MM).MILD ASCITES. MINIMAL RIGHT PLEURAL EFFUSION.MULTIPLE MUCOID-IMPACTED BRONCHIOLES AT LUNG BASES. OVERALL CONSTELLATION OF FINDINGS (SITUS INVERSUS + BRONCHIAL CHANGES) IS CONSISTENT WITH KARTAGENER'S SYNDROME/PRIMARY CILIARY DYSKINESIA.

USG W/A(1/9/25, AIIMS): Chronic pancreatitis with Pseudocyst formation, Moderate Splenomegaly, borderline Hepatomegaly

USG splenoportal axis (4/9/25, AIIMS):in a k/c/o situs inversus: SPLEEN-15 cm,(moderately enlarged),normal shape & echotexture, multiple collaterals noted at splenic hilum. Visualized part of splenic vein in pancreatic body& head region appears normal. LIVER-14.9 cm, normal shape, size & echotexture. PV diameter-9.1cm,PSV-811cm/s.no IHBRD, intrahepatic IVC,hepatic veind; normal.

### ADVICE ON DISCHARGE:

Normal diet (Low fat, High protein)

Cap Omeprazole 20mg 1OD x 7days

Tab Paracetamol 650 mg TDS x7 days

Tab Tramadol 50 mg TDS x 7 days

Syp. Ambroxol 2 TSF TDS x 7 days

Tab Amitryptline 10mg 1 HS continue

Tab Naxdom 50 Mg SOS

Tab Levocetrizine 10 mg 1HS x 7days

## Summary

**Study ID:** AP-SVT-002

**Classification:** **SVT CASE - ISOLATED SPLENIC VEIN OCCLUSION (CHRONIC)**

**Key Points:**
1. 34-year-old male with acute on chronic calcific pancreatitis
2. Etiology: Alcohol (7-year history, stopped 2 years back)
3. **SPLENIC VEIN OCCLUSION - CHRONIC with established collaterals**
   - Documented on CECT: 26-Aug-2025
   - Extent: Complete occlusion
   - Multiple collaterals at splenic hilum and perigastric region
4. Portal vein and SMV: PATENT
5. Left-sided (sinistral) portal hypertension:
   - Moderate splenomegaly (15 cm)
   - Mild ascites
   - Multiple collaterals
   - Varices status UNKNOWN (UGIE pending)
6. Complicated by:
   - **Kartagener Syndrome** (rare genetic disorder)
   - Pseudocyst formation (3.8×6 cm)
   - Dilated MPD (15 mm) - ductal disease
   - Chronic analgesic abuse
   - Dyslipidemia (high TG, low HDL)
7. **ANTICOAGULATION NOT STARTED** - chronic thrombosis with established collaterals
8. Conservative management successful
9. **DAMA** - requires follow-up for UGIE and further evaluation

**CRITICAL RESEARCH NOTES:**
1. **Chronic isolated SV occlusion** with well-established collateral circulation
2. **Left-sided/sinistral portal hypertension** - different from conventional portal hypertension
3. **NO anticoagulation** - appropriate for chronic occlusion with collaterals
4. **Kartagener syndrome** - rare congenital disorder complicating management
5. **Requires UGIE urgently** to assess for gastric varices (risk of bleeding)
6. **Chronic calcific pancreatitis** - ongoing pancreatic ductal disease
7. **DAMA** - compliance may be an issue

---

                                                                                                   ������������ / D.O.

CHIEF COMPLAINTS:
Abdominal pain x 3 months
Abdominal lump x 1 month
Vomiting on and off x 3 days
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient is a k/c/o Acute pancreatitis(alcohol induced) with pancreatic collection. Patient initially had
abdominal pain on Dec 2023, for which he was admitted in General medicine ward on 27/12/23 and was evaluated and diagnosed as
a case of acute pancreatitis and managed conservatively and discharged on 30/12/23 . Then patient developed fever, SOB,
abdominal pain for which he was admitted in General medicine ward again on 05/01/24 and was evaluated. CECT abdomen was
done which showed acute pancreatitis with peripancreatic collection, ALD with Grade III fatty liver with alcoholic hepatitis. IVR
consultation was done and USG guided pigtail drainage was done on 18-01-24 and serial USG monitoring was done and pigtail




                                                                                                                                Page No: 1

                                                                                           CR: 239212303062938




removed on 29-01-24, since USG showed minimal collection and patient was discharged on 31/1/24 . Then again patient developed
abdominal pain and distension, high grade fever and chills in feb 2024, for which he got admitted in private hospital in Bhopal on
15/02/24 and was diagnosed as a case of alcoholic liver disease with ascites with acute necrotising pancreatitis with necrotic
collection and was managed conservatively and discharged on 23/02/24. At that time patient had elevated LFT and RFT. Now patient
presented in TEM, AIIMS, Bhopal with abdominal pain over epigastrium and left side of Abdomen, which is radiating to back and
vomiting and was admitted in TEM deptton 21-03-24 where routine blood investigations and imaging (USG) were done . General
medicine, General Surgery consultation were done. Patient was then transferred to SGE ward on 22-03-24 for further management.
H/O abdominal lump +(over Left lower quadrant ) x 1 month
No H/O fever / abdominal distension / hematemesis / melena / jaundice .
H/O anorexia + H/O loss of weight + .
Pt is an alcoholic for 10 years , consumes daily , stopped in December 2023. No known comorbidities. No known allergies.
CASE SUMMARY: O/E Patient is conscious, oriented to time , place and person
Weight-91KG, Height - 174m, BMI - 30.1kg/m2
No pallor , No icterus, no Lymphadenopathy, no edema.
BP- 132/92 mm Hg, PR - 74/min, SpO2 - 98%, Temp -afebrile , BHT -21 sec.
P/A - soft, not distended, non tender, palpable lump of size around 15 x 10 cm, which is firm in consistency, non-tender, relatively
fixed, extending from epigatrium upto LIF. Healed healthy scar of previous PCD site noted over LIF .
No guarding/rigidity ,no organomegaly.


CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Hemodynamically stable, symptomatically better, afebrile, accepting oral diet, passing flatus & motion.
FINAL DIAGNOSIS:
Acute necrotising pancreatitis (Alcoholic) with giant walled off necrosis


Splenic vein thrombosis;


Sinistral portal hypertension


Gastric varices


Candidiasis;


Anemia;


HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient was admitted with above mentioned complaints in TEM on 21/03/24. Routine blood investigations (Hb
��� 7.5 , TLC -9900) and imaging ( USG and CECT abdomen ) were done. General surgery and Gastromedicine opinion were
obtained. Patient was transferred to SGE ward on 22/03/24. Patient was evalauted and was planned for surgical management of
walled off necrosis. Gastromedicine opinion was obtained for UGIE i/v/o splenic vein thrombosis, UGIE was done on 11/4/24 which
showed Gastric varices. Patient was found to have left HUN on CT scan, Urology opinion was obtained and advice followed.
Pulmonology opinion was obtained for left pleural effusion and advise followed. 1 unit PRBC for transfused on 9/4/24 for anemia as
suggested in PAC for preop optimisation. After getting PAC fitness and informed consent, patient underwent surgery ( exploratory
laparotomy with necrosectomy and drainage of collection and cystojejunostomy) on 12/04/24. Intraop period was uneventful. Oral
sips were started from POD -1 and gradually increased as per tolerance,. Drain was removed on POD -5. Patient had fever from POD -
2 onwards which was high grade, persisted throughout the hospital stay . Multiple cultures (pus c/s ��� bacterial and fungal, blood




                                                                                                                                 Page No: 2

                                                                                               CR: 239212303062938




c/s- 5 times sterile, Urine c/s, Central line tip c/s ) were sent and antibiotics and antifungals were started empirically initially, then
switched to appropriate antibiotics and antifungal based on sensitivity. Patient was evaluated with CT scan, residual collection was
noted and was drained with PCD. PCD catheters were gradually upsized from Malecot 14 Fr to ADK 24 Fr for better drainage. Urology
opinion was obtained i/v/o persistent left HUN and left DJ stent was placed on 03/05/24. DVT lower limb screening with color Doppler
was done with no e/o DVT found. Pulmonary medicine and Critical care medicine consultation taken for postop fever and advise
followed. Patient was found to have candidiasis (pus C/S shows growth of Candida glabrata two times), managed with Inj
Caspofungin for 3 weeks. Fever gradually subsided. Post op recovery was otherwise uneventful. Patient was managed with antibiotics
(Inj. Piperacillin tazobactum, Inj. Cefoperazone sulbactum, Inj. Meropenam, Inj. Metronidazole, Inj. Amikacin, Inj. Tigecycline, Inj.
Minocycline, inj. Moxifloxacin) and antifungals (Inj. Fluconazole, Inj. Caspofungin ), iv PPI, analgesics and other supportive and
symptomatic treatment. Abdominal drain removed on 03/06/24. Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, tolerating orals,
passing stools, afebrile for past 4 days and hence being discharged in stable condition with left DJ stent insitu .
OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: CECT ABD -AIIMS - 12/01/2024-IMPRESSION: CECT Abdomen reveals:non enhancing parenchyma (>30%)
involving head and body suggesting necrotic pancreatic parenchyma with extensive peri-pancreatic and mesentric fat stranding
.multiple intercommunicating pockets of collection replacing pancreatic parenchyma at head and body extending into peripancreatic
regions .
CECT ABD -AIIMS - 02/04/2024- Acute necrotizing pancreatitis involving the pancreatic body and tail region with walled off necrotic
collection extension as described with splenic vein thrombosis and left pleural effusion (Modified CTSI-10; severe pancreatitis) . Mild
left hydroureteronephrosis due to extrinsic compression by the above mentioned collection.
HPE (12-04-24)- Specimen-Necrotic part off collection- Consistent with diagnosis of post acute necrotizing pancreatitis.
CECT ABD -AIIMS - 26/04/2024-IMPRESSION: CECT Abdomen reveals:Heterogeneously enhancing pancreatic parenchyma with focal
patchy areas of hypo enhancement involving >30% of pancreatic parenchyma. Multiple variable size intra parenchymal and
peripancreatic peripherally enhancing necrotic collections in lesser sac, extending in left para colic gutter reaching upto pelvic cavity
with peripancreatic fat stranding as described. Multiple air foci in non-dependent portions within collections -? post procedural
??Communication with adjacent small bowel loop. Adv- Positive oral contrast study. There is encasement of left ureter by these
collections with upstream moderate hydroureteronephrosis. Moderate Left pleural effusion.
USG chest -AIIMS -8/5/24-Moderate pleural effusion
CECT ABD -AIIMS - 28-05-24- It shows heterogeneous enhancement with mild peripancreatic fat stranding.
The body and tail of pancreas ( greater than 30% of pancreatic parenchyma) are near completely replaced by a relatively defined
peripherally enhancing heterogeneously hypodense collection, which is extending into peripancreatic region and extra-pancreatic
regionThere are air foci noted within the above mentioned collections -? post procedural.
It is completely encasing the splenic vein with it���s luminal irregularity and narrowing ��� suggestive of chronic thrombosis.
Also completely encasing the splenic artery, with no evidence of any luminal irregularity or focal outpouching. The splenoportal
confluence and SMV are normal in caliber and contrast opacification. The GDA appears normal, with no evidence of any luminal
irregularity or focal outpouching. There are multiple subcentimetric and few enlarged peripancreatic, para aortic and aorto-caval
lymph nodes are noted largest of size 3.2 x 1.4 cm near head of pancreas. Mild pericardial effusion.Moderate fluid in left pleural
cavity (max thickness 4.2 cm) with subsegmental collapse of visualized LLL.
OPERATION PERFORMED:
Exploratory Laparotomy with necrosectomy and drainage of collection with Roux en Y cystojejunostomy On 12-Apr-2024
OPERATIVE FINDINGS: Giant walled off necrotic collection in left flank with about 4 litres of blackish brown fluid with lots of blackish
necrotic material. Collection extending in the retroperitoneum towards pancreas (body/tail) & spleen and towards pelvis, and pushing
descending colon medially. Omental saponification noted. Perihepatic fibrinous adhesions present. Upper abdomen apparently
normal. Visualised small & large bowel loops normal. Mild inflammatory changes present around collection. Cystojejunostomy stoma
length ~5 cm. Roux limb length ~ 40 cm




                                                                                                                                     Page No: 3

                                                                                        CR: 239212303062938




ADVICE ON DISCHARGE:
High protein diet.
STRICT ALCOHOL ABSTINENCE
Tab Moxifloxacin 400 mg OD X 5 days
Tab. Pantoprazole 40mg OD x 7 days.
Tab. Paracetamol 500 mg TDS X 3 days then SOS
Tab. Ondansetron 4mg SOS.
Tab Veltam -S 1HS as advised in Urology
Syp Lactulose 15 ml HS
Cap B Complex 1 OD
To review in SGE OPD
To review in Urology OPD regarding left DJ stent
To review in Gastromedicine OPD for management of gastric Varices
DISCHARGE BY : Dr Vishal Gupta
DISCHARGE REMARKS : Patient is having left DJ stent insitu. To review in Urology OPD regarding the same.
To review in SGE OPD .
FOLLOW UP ON : 27-Feb-2025
FOLLOW UP CONSULTANT / FACULTY : Dr Vishal Gupta
FOLLOW UP ADVICE : To review in TEM in case of persistent abdominal pain, abdominal distension, vomiting, fever, jaundice etc.

Dr S Sriram                                                      Dr Vishal Gupta

### CHIEF COMPLAINTS:

Not passing stool and flatus x 1 day

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient is a follow up case of Acute severe necrotizing pancreatitis with giant walled off necrosis who was admitted in SGE department from March 2024 till June 2024 and underwent pancreatic necrosectomy and with Roux en Y cystogastrostomy on 12/4/2025. He remained asymptomatic since discharge and was on regular follow up. Now he presented with pain abdomen since 1 day in emergency (TEM). Pain was in epigastrium and right upper abdomen, severe in nature, radiating to back, partially relieved with analgesics exaggerated following food intake. Pain was associated with nausea and gaseous distension of the abdomen. He also has not passed flatus and stool since 1 day. No h/o vomiting, fever, jaundice, melena, hematemesis. No known comorbidities. H/o alcohol intake for 10 years; abstinence since 1 year. No h/o addictions or allergies.

CASE SUMMARY: Patient was conscious, oriented to time, place and person. Moderately built and nourished. No Pallor /Icterus/LN/Clubbing.Neck-NAD.PR-78min, BP-130/80mmHg, Afebrile, SP02 98%.weight-90kg, Height-174cm, BMI-30 Kg/m2, P/Atenderness in epigastric region and RUQ, non-distended, no organomegaly, no ascites, Midline scar+, Supraumbilical incisional hernia with defect size 2 cm present.

CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, pain free, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating orals, passing flatus and motion, abdomen soft, non tender and hence being discharged in stable condition.

## FINAL DIAGNOSIS:

Recurrent acute pancreatitis (mild)

F/U/C/O Acute necrotising pancreatitis with giant Walled Off Necrosis with Splenic vein thrombosis with portal vein thrombosis

S/P Exploratory laparotomy with necrosectomy with cystojejunostomy (April 2024)

S/P DJ stenting for left HUN( Removed )

Incisional hernia

HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient was admitted in TEM for above mentioned complaints, Routine blood investigations were done (Hb-14, TLC-10780, Plt-2.8 L, TB-0.6, DB-0.09, SGOT/SGPT-13/10,ALP/GGT-72/19, TP/ALB- 7.9/4.2, Urea/creat - 17/0.8, PT/INR-13/1,aPTT-25, S.

![](_page_1_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_1_Picture_3.jpeg)

Amylase/S.Lipase-783/719,Viral markers-NR). SGE opinion was taken and was advised to keep him NPO, give IV analgesics, and to get a USG abdomen. USG was done on 8/10/2025 and it revealed supraumbilical hernia and prominent left PCS. Patient had symptomatic improvement following analgesics, SGE review was taken on 8/10/2025 and was advised to give PC enema BD following which he started passing stool and flatus. He was shifted to SGE ward on 8/10/2025 for further management. He was started oral liquids which he tolerated. He continued having intermittent abdominal pain radiating to back and was managed with IV analgesics. Repeat USG was done on 11/10/2025 which revealed bulky heterogenous pancreas with fat stranding s/o pancreatitis. Blood investigations were repeated on 10/10/2025 and was within normal limits. His pain abdomen started decreasing in intensity and was started on oral semisolid diet from 12/10/2025 which he tolerated. Currently he is tolerating orally, passing stool and flatus, pain free. Labs sent on 10/10/25 reported HB-15, TLC-9290, plt-2.8 L, Na/K-132/4.2. During hospital course, patient managed with PPI, antiemetics, analgesics, tramadol and other symptomatic & supportive care. Plan: CECT abdomen on 17/11/2025, to follow Calcium and Triglycerides levels reports.

OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: USG W/A(08/10/25,AIIMS)- A Supraumbilical defect in anterior abdominal wall with preperitoneal fat as its content. Prominent left PCS with prominent ureter.

USG W/A(11/10/25,AIIMS)-Visualized part of pancreas(diameter of head=35mm)bulky, heterogeneously hypoechoic, few hyperechoic areas noted in the pancreatic parenchyma. Pancreatic duct diam~4.4 mm & mildly dilated, surrounding fat stranding, no surrounding collection seen. F/S/O Inflammatory changes within the pancreas, however further evaluation with CT is advised.

### ADVICE ON DISCHARGE:

Strict Alcohol Abstinence ; Low fat soft diet ; Tab Tramadol 50mg sos X 5 Days; Tab Pantoprazole 40mg OD X 5 Days ; Tab

Domperidone 10mg TDS x 3 days; Tab Paracetamol 500mg SOS Fever

Review in SGE OPD with CECT report and calcium, Triglyceride reports on Thursday in Pancreas Clinic.

DISCHARGE BY : Dr Vishal Gupta

DISCHARGE REMARKS :

FOLLOW UP ON : 23-Oct-2025

FOLLOW UP CONSULTANT / FACULTY : Dr Vishal Gupta

FOLLOW UP ADVICE : To follow up in TEM AIIMS / local hospital in case of severe or persistent pain abdomen, vomiting, fever,

abdominal distension, obstipation etc.

Summary Prepared By Summary Approved By

Dr Maidh Pavneet Singh Dr Vishal Gupta

As compared to previous scan dated 26/4/24, - There is decrease in size of retroperitoneal collection. - There is mild increase in left pleural effusion and pericardial effusion. ●

- Both kidneys are normal in size, shape and CT attenuation with normal cortical enhancement. PCS appears normal. No obvious hydronephrosis is seen. Both ureters are normal in caliber. ●
- Both adrenals appear normal.
- Urinary bladder- Is distended and smooth in outline. No e/o any calculus / wall thickening noted. ●

| PCD placement (14Fr→24Fr) | Post-op 2024 | Residual collection | Successful drainage |

|-----------|----------------------|-------------|-------------|

## 10. Status at Last Follow-up (October 2025)

| Parameter | Status |
|-----------|--------|
| **Vascular Status** | [x] Splenic vein THROMBOSED (chronic) |

| **Portal Hypertension** | [x] Present (sinistral/left-sided) |
| - Splenomegaly | No |
| - Collaterals/Cavernoma | Present |
| - Esophagogastric varices | **GASTRIC VARICES** |
| - Portal Gastropathy | Yes |

### Other Relevant Morbidity/Complications

- Chronic splenic vein thrombosis (complete encasement)
- Gastric varices (HIGH risk - no bleeding so far)
- Acute-on-chronic pancreatitis
- Pancreatic atrophy (distal body)
- Pancreatic calcifications
- Dilated MPD (6 mm)
- Incisional hernia (post-operative)
- Hyperlipidemia (requires management)
- Past Candida glabrata infection (treated)

---

## Summary

**Study ID:** AP-SVT-003

**Classification:** **SVT CASE - ISOLATED SPLENIC VEIN THROMBOSIS (CHRONIC)**

**Key Points:**
1. 33-year-old obese male with severe acute necrotizing pancreatitis (CTSI 10/10)
2. Etiology: Alcohol (10-year history, stopped December 2023) + Hypertriglyceridemia
3. **SPLENIC VEIN THROMBOSIS - CHRONIC with complete encasement**
   - First documented: 02-Apr-2024
   - Extent: Complete chronic thrombosis
   - Stable at 19-month follow-up
4. Portal vein and SMV: PATENT (PV dilated 14.5-18mm)
5. Left-sided (sinistral) portal hypertension:
   - **GASTRIC VARICES present** (UGIE 11/4/24)
   - Portal gastropathy
   - No splenomegaly
   - PV dilatation
6. Complicated by:
   - Giant WON requiring surgery (4L drained)
   - Candida glabrata infection
   - Respiratory failure with pleural effusion
   - Now chronic pancreatitis with atrophy and calcifications
   - Recurrent acute episodes
   - Incisional hernia
   - Hyperlipidemia
7. **ANTICOAGULATION NOT STARTED** due to GASTRIC VARICES (high bleeding risk)
8. Successful surgical management with Roux-en-Y cystojejunostomy
9. Alive with no variceal bleeding at 19-month follow-up

**CRITICAL RESEARCH NOTES:**
1. **Chronic isolated SV thrombosis** with complete encasement
2. **GASTRIC VARICES** - contraindication to anticoagulation
3. **NO variceal bleeding** despite varices and no anticoagulation
4. **Left-sided portal hypertension** without conventional portal hypertension signs
5. **Successful long-term survival** with chronic SVT
6. **Complex surgical case** with prolonged (75-day) hospital stay
7. **Metabolic factors** (hypertriglyceridemia) contributing to recurrent pancreatitis

---

**Data Collection Date:** 15-January-2026
**Data Collected By:** Dr Sarath Chandrabhatla
**Last Updated:** 15-January-2026

# Department : Surgical Gastroenterology Discharge Summary

| CR No.: 239212502538461          | Name: Aayuesh Kirad                                  | Age/Gender: 20 Yr/M                  |
|----------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
| Admission No.: 239212025051923   | Department Unit: Surgical Gastroenterology (Surgical | Consultant/Faculty: Dr Vishal Gupta  |
|                                  | Gastroenterology)                                    |                                      |
| Ward: Gastro Surgery Ward        | Room/Bed: Gastro Srg Ward Room/ Bed 2                | Patient Category: Ayushman Bharat    |
| Discharge Type: Normal Discharge | Father/Spouse Name: Mr Kirad/-                       | Occupation:                          |
| Contact No.: 9301252216          | Address: Guna, Madhya Pradesh,,BPL,Guna              | State/Country Madhya                 |
|                                  |                                                      | Pradesh/India                        |
| D.O.A. : 25-Aug-2025 12:42       | D.O.D. : 01-Sep-2025                                 | D.O. Print Report: 01-Sep-2025 16:49 |

## CHIEF COMPLAINTS:

Abdominal pain, on &off for 6 months

Fever for 3 days

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient was apparently asymptomatic 6 months back, when he developed abdominal pain, sudden in onset, progressive in nature. Patient consulted elsewhere and was admitted in multiple hospitals ,evaluated with imaging, diagnosed to have acute pancreatitis with intraabdominal collection, managed conservatively and got symptomatic relief. For almost 2 months, patient was symptom free following which patient started developing abdominal pain on & off, which required iv analgesics in between and was managed conservatively. History of fever on & off(no documentation available),currently c/o fever for 3 days, h/o significant weight loss present(~26 kgs in 6-7 months).No h/o jaundice or GI bleed. Patient consulted elsewhere for these complaints and currently consulted in SGE OPD and was admitted for further management. Recently diagnosed case of DM, on insulin for 3-4 months. Not a k/c/o HTN/TB/BA/CAD. He takes mixed diet, normal bladder & bowel habits. no significant family history. No addictions or known allergy.

CASE SUMMARY: Patient conscious, oriented to time place and person, moderately built and nourished.

HR- 112bpm,RR-18/min,BP-84/64mmHg,SPo2-99%,afebrile.weight-44.2kg,height-164cm,BMI-16.4kg/m2

No Pallor/ icterus /Edema/LN/Clubbing

Chest-b /l AE+,NVBS,CVS-s1s2 heard, CNS-NFND,

P/A-soft, non tender, not distended, warmth+, no organomegaly, no ascites ,no scars

CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating orals, passing flatus and motion, abdomen soft, non tender and hence being discharged in stable condition.

# FINAL DIAGNOSIS:

Acute necrotising pancreatitis;

Splenic vein thrombosis;

Diabetes mellitus;

HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient presented at SGE OPD with above mentioned complaints and was admitted for further management, Routine blood investigations were done (Hb-12.3, TLC-7660, TB-0.54, DB-0.14, SGOT/SGPT-38/31 ALP-214, TP/ALB- 6.8/3.3, Urea/creat ��� 13.71/0.73, PT/INR-13.7/1.2, amylase/lipase-63/19). He was started on iv antibiotics. Endocrinology consultation was sought for management for Diabetes Mellitus and advice was followed. On 26th August, VIR Consultation was sought for Drainage of Collection, revealed no e/o obvious collection in peritoneal cavity. USG was done on 29/8/2025 and revealed no drainable collections. He became

![](_page_1_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_1_Picture_3.jpeg)

afebrile and is currently asymptomatic. During hospital course, patient was managed conservatively with iv antibiotics (Meropenem), iv PPI, iv analgesics, IV antiemetics, and other symptomatic & supportive care.

OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: USG W/A(17/02/2025,Outside) GB wall is thin and smooth, thickness is within normal limits. No sludge and calculi seen. Pancreas - appears bulky and heterogeneous with peripancreatic fat stranding and collection, s/o- possibility of acute pancreatitis.

CECT WHOLE ABDOMEN (21.02.2025,Outside) Pancreas appears bulky, showing heterogeneous CT attenuation with poorly defined outlines. Multifocal nonenhancing hypodense areas are seen diffusely involving most of pancreas. Moderate inflammatory changes are seen in peripancreatic regions (in the form of inflammatory fat stranding) involving regions of gastrohepatic, gastrosplenic & splenorenal ligaments, extending inferiorly along bilateral anterior pararenal fascias, lateroconal fascias, upto paracolic gutters. No evidence of calcification is seen. Visualized MPD is not dilated. Adjacent walls of stomach & small as well as large bowel loops are showing variable reactionary mural thickening

USG W/A(21.03.2025,Outside):Pancreas appears bulky, shows heterogeneous echotexture and ill defined peripancreatic outlines. MPD is not dilated. There is evidence of mild inflammatory changes (in the form of inflammatory fat stranding and small fluid) seen involving peripancreatic areas. No significant collection pocket is seen. On color doppler examination, pancreas is showing minimal patchy vascularity. No obvious pseudocyst formation is noted on present

USG W/A (01/04/25,Outside):PANCREAS-bulky head, body & tail, Homogenous mass , f/c/o pancreatitis, normal pancreatic duct. CT - WHOLE ABDOMEN (CONTRAST)(30-06-2025,Outside)Large loculated low attenuation collection is seen in retroperitoneum, involving almost entire pancreas and extending into splenic hilum. Collection measures approx. 3.6 x 13.6 x 5.1cm. Mild inflammatory stranding is seen in peripancreatic region and lesser sac with mild thickening of left anterior pararenal fascia. Inflammatory thickening of gastric wall is seen.Multiple small subcentimeter sized discrete and non-necrotic mesenteric lymphnodes are seen, largest measuring approx. 09 x 14mm. CT severity index 4+4+2 = 10

USG W/A(12-08-2025,Outside) Visualized pancreas is replaced by a large heterogeneous sausage shaped non-liquefied phlegmonous collection of size 11 x 7 x 5 cm (volume approx. 150-200cc) - likely walled off necrotic collection. There is raised peripancreatic fat echogenicity with few vascular collaterals and diffuse gastric wall thickening - likely necrotizing pancreatitis sequelae. There is marked attenuation of porto-splenic confluence with non visualization of retropancreatic splenic vein - likely chronic venous thrombosis. Multiple discrete subcentimetric sized peripancreatic & retroperitoneal lymph nodes are seen.Spleen: is normal in size (10.0 cm) and echotexture.

CECT ABDOMEN & PELVIS(12.08.2025,Outside) Pancreas is bulky with peripancreatic fat stranding. Elongated collection of size 2.8 x 10 cms is seen along the length of pancreas within pancreas likely dilated MPD. Liver is normal in size 14cms and shows fatty infiltration (mean HU +57).Multiple fat necrosis nodules/lymph nodes are seen in surroundings in mesentery and in retroperitoneum. Reactive thickening and edema seen along C loops of duodenum with distended stomach. Splenic vein is not seen likely thrombosed and absorbed.

USG GUIDED FNAC(26.02.2025,Outside)Under strict aseptic precautions and USG guidance single pass was taken from pancreatic necrosis. Approx 04 cc of necrotic material was aspirated and sample handed over for C/S evaluations. No procedural complication was seen.

UGIE(MAY 2025)-Esophagus-normal. Stomach-antral gastritis. Duodenum-normal.

USG W/A(29/08/25,AIIMS)LIVER-Borderline enlarged(15.7cm), IHBR nondilated, PV normal hepatopetal flow, Hepatic veins& intra hepatic IVC normal, Triangular area in segment 8 of liver showing less attenuation compared to surrounding liver parenchyma, with vessels traversing the area s/o focal fat sparing. GB-Thick edematous wall. CBD-proximal non dilated. SPLEEN- normal in shape, size & echotexture. PANCREAS: head-26mm,body-29mm,tail-31mm, appears slightly bulky with surrounding fat stranding & thin rim of peripancreatic free fluid & shows heterogenous echotexture.

### ADVICE ON DISCHARGE:

High protein low fat diet

![](_page_2_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_2_Picture_3.jpeg)

Tab MONTELEUKAST+ LEVOCETRIZINE HS x 7 days

Inj NPH S/C 12U at 8am, 6U at 10pm

Inj Regular Insulin S/C 6U Before Breakfast, 8U Before Lunch, 4U Before Dinner

Tab PANTOPRAZOLE 40mg OD x 7 days

Follow up in endocrinology OPD for management of DM.

To monitor sugar levels at home as advised by endocrinology cx and watch for hypoglycemic symptoms.

## Summary

**Study ID:** AP-SVT-001

**Classification:** **SVT CASE - ISOLATED SPLENIC VEIN THROMBOSIS**

**Key Points:**
1. 20-year-old male with severe acute necrotizing pancreatitis (CTSI 10/10)
2. Etiology: Idiopathic (workup incomplete - lipid profile, calcium not done)
3. **SPLENIC VEIN THROMBOSIS - CHRONIC, COMPLETE**
   - First documented: 12-Aug-2025
   - Extent: Complete (vein not visualized on CECT)
   - Porto-splenic confluence: Marked attenuation
4. Portal vein and SMV: PATENT
5. Early portal hypertensive changes:
   - Few collaterals present
   - Gastric wall thickening
   - NO varices on UGIE
   - NO splenomegaly (yet)
6. Complicated by:
   - New-onset Diabetes Mellitus
   - Severe weight loss (26 kg)
   - Transient cardiovascular dysfunction
   - Walled-off necrosis
7. **ANTICOAGULATION NOT STARTED**
8. Conservative management successful
9. Young age (20 years) - idiopathic etiology needs further workup

**CRITICAL RESEARCH NOTES:**
1. **Isolated SV thrombosis** - PV and SMV remain patent
2. **Chronic thrombosis** - vein completely absorbed/not visualized
3. **NO anticoagulation given** - rationale needs documentation
4. **Early portal hypertension signs** without varices - needs surveillance
5. **Young age with idiopathic pancreatitis** - consider genetic/metabolic workup
6. **New-onset DM** - likely pancreatogenic (Type 3c)

---

# Department : Surgical Gastroenterology Death Summary

| CR No.: 239212502746919        | Name: Ankit Chimaniya                                | Age/Gender: 35 Yr/M                  |
|--------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------|--------------------------------------|
| Admission No.: 239212025056056 | Department Unit: Surgical Gastroenterology (Surgical | Consultant/Faculty: Dr Pravesh       |
|                                | Gastroenterology)                                    | Mathur                               |
| Ward: Medical ICU              | Room/Bed: Medical ICU Room 111022/ ISO Bed 15        | Patient Category: Ayushman Bharat    |
| Discharge Type: Death          | Father/Spouse Name: Ramvilash Chimaniya/-            | Occupation:                          |
| Contact No.: 9977997678        | Address: Makan N0 189, Ward N0 7, Mata Mohalla,      | State/Country Madhya                 |
|                                | Pathrauta, Hoshang,,H,Bhopal                         | Pradesh/India                        |
| D.O.A. : 12-Sep-2025 19:40     | D.O.D. : 06-Nov-2025                                 | D.O. Print Report: 06-Nov-2025 16:32 |

## CHIEF COMPLAINTS:

Pain Abdomen x 4 months

Vomiting x 4 months ago

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Apparently asymptomatic till 5th August when he had sudden episode of pain, moderate to severe in intensity, following alcohol intake, diffusely involving the whole abdomen radiating to back. The pain was associated with multiple episodes of vomiting, gastritis, and high-grade fever. He was admitted at local hospital for 2 days. Referred to Bansal Hospital, where he was admitted from 11���������21st August. Hospital records not available; underwent single time aspiration twice from abdomen. He was discharged on 21/8/2015 with mild symptomatic relief. Readmitted at Global Hospital from 21/8/25. Referred to AIIMS in view of the need for a ventilator. Admitted in TEM, initially managed conservatively, then shifted to SGE ward for further management. Previous Intervention: single-time aspiration (August-twice) . Personal History: Mixed diet, smoking (8years), tobacco chewing (8 Years), Alcohol intake (5 years). Family History: a. Similar Illness: Nil asthma/COPD x 5 years. Mother on inhaler for 1 year. no h/o DM/HTN/Asthma/Bleeding Tendencies/Cancers. Drug History: h/o liver disease on medication x 6 months.

CASE SUMMARY: Patient conscious oriented to time,place and person ,fairly nourished, NJ insitu .NoEdema/LN/clubbing/pallor/icterus are present. Weight- 55.5kg ,height- 172 cm, BMI- 18.8 kg/m2 ,PR-78/min BP- 110/70 mmhg RR- 20 Spo2- 98% .On examination-Chest- normal breath sounds present ,P/A-Mild distension, no tenderness,no organomegaly

CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Pt expired.

### FINAL DIAGNOSIS:

Acute on Chronic Pancreatitis

Walled off necrosis

Sepsis

Liver dysfunction

Contained duodenal leak

Retroperitoneal hemorrhage

Shock

![](_page_1_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_1_Picture_3.jpeg)

MODS

Portal vein thrombosis;

Splenic vein thrombosis;

HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient was admitted to the SGE ward for above mentioned complaints. Necessary blood investigations were done. CECT abdomen done (16/9/25) revealed pancreatic necrosis & peripancreatic emphysematous collection. IVR consultation done and CT guided B/L PCDs were placed retroperitoneally for collections, which were draining 100-150ml of pus & necrotic material per day. Pt was planned for surgery (retroperitoneal debridement) in case of persistent sepsis. On 30/09/25, two additional PCDs were placed into B/L intra-abdominal collections on the anterior aspect. Pt then had enteric output from right sided drains. CECT abdomen done on 1/10/25, revealed contrast leak likely from the D3 segment of duodenum, leak resolved spontaneously. Pt developed respiratory distress with left pleural effusion, sudden onset tachycardia & respiratory alkalosis. SICU, MICU, Pulmonology and cardiology consultations were sought & necessary advice was followed. Gastromedicine consultation was done i/v/o deranged LFT & was diagnosed as hepatic dysfunction (possible sepsis induced) & pt was started on liver protective agents. MICU and SICU consultations were sought for further management and transfer, as the patient required ICU care. On 15/10/25, after correction of anemia & coagulopathy, after obtaining informed high-risk consent, sequential necrosectomy was done i/v/o poor GC. Initially left side pancreatic necrosectomy (VARD) under spinal anesthesia done (15/10/25). Pt was shifted to MICU (CCM). Pt developed respiratory distress with hypertension 16/10/25, pt was intubated & started on ionotropes. On 17/10/25, right necrosectomy (VARD). Post debridement, pt improved. Drainage were initially purulent with necrotic material but after about a week enteric output was noted on right sided drains. Pt needed prolonged ventilatory support & hence tracheostomy was done. Intermittent extubation trial were given but pt did not tolerate. Pt was managed with antibiotics (Ceftazidime avibactum, aztreonam, metronidazole & antifungal), NJ feeds & drain irrigation & other supportive care. For the past 4-5 days, pt had enteric output in left sided drains. urgent CT scan done with oral+NJ+rectal & iv contrast (provisional report NJ tube eroding distal duodenum & jejunum with tip in jejunum; Final report awaited). Hence pt was planned for emergency surgery after PT correction. On 6/11/25 at around 1.30 am pt had acute onset bleeding from both the peridrain site with fall in Hb, hypotension which required dual ionotrope support. Immediately 4 FFP & 1 PRBC transfusion. Urgent DSA / angioembolisation was planned, but pt condition rapidly deteriorated with severe acidosis, anuria & hence DSA could not be done. Patient then developed ventricular tachyarrythmia at around 11.30am on 6/11/25. Patient was resuscitated as per ACLS protocol and 3cycles of CPR given. In-spite of all the resuscitative measures, pt could not be revived & declared dead on 6/11/25 at 12.01 pm.

OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: CECT abdomen(28/08/25,Outside)-f/s/o moderate to severe necrotising pancreatitis of ct score 8large peripancreatic fluid collection extending into bilateral pararenal, paracolic, illac fossae, greater and lesser sacs, compressing the pancreas, stomach, and small bowel loops.Largest dimensions: 9 ������ 10 cm (right) and 8 x 10 cm (left).multifocal pancreatic necrosis with peripancreatic inflammation. Moderate left pleural effusion.gb sludge; prominent intrahepatic biliary radicles and cbd.Mild porta hepatis edema.no vascular complication identified, but thinning of splenic and portal veins is noted.no bowel obstruction or perforation.

CECT abdomen (12/09/25,Outside)-Pancreas shows fuzzy margins, appears diffusely bulky and is hypoenhancing. No evidence of pancreatic necrosis. Moderate peri pancreatic fat streakiness with thickening of bilateral anterior renal and conal ascites, There Is moderate collection in perigastric, peripancreatic and paracolic regions. Mild ascites.

USG W/A (13/9/25,AIIMS)-Diffuse peri pancreatic fat stranding noted.

(CECT abdomen 16/09/25,AIIMS)- Heterogenously enhancing pancreatic parenchyma predominantly in the distal body and tailregion (pancreatic parenchymal necrosis)- involving greater than 30% ofpancreatic parenchyma.A relatively-defined large irregular shaped peripherally enhancing hypodense collection withmultiple air foci within surrounding the entire length of the pancreas ,extending to

![](_page_2_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_2_Picture_3.jpeg)

anteriorperi-pancreatic ,subhepatic , lesser sac and till the splenic hilum region with morphology. Contiguous extension of the collection pockets along bilateral pararenal, bilateral paracolicgutters till the iliac fossae and into the presacral region.Severe luminal attenuation with faint &patchy contrast opacification of splenic vein nearporto-splenic confluence- likely partially thrombosed. CECT abdomen (27/09/25,AIIMS)-Pancreatic parenchyma shows heterogenous enhancement with fuzzy margins along itsentire length, predominantly in the distal body and tail region (pancreatic parenchymalnecrosis)- involving greater than 30% of pancreatic parenchyma.relatively-defined irregular shaped peripherally enhancing hypodense collection withmultiple air foci within is noted surrounding the entire length of the pancreas ,extending toanterior peri-pancreatic ,subhepatic , lesser sac and till the splenic hilum region withmorphology and extent as described. It also shows extensions along bilateral pararenal,bilateral paracolic gutters till the iliac fossae.It measures 21.5 x 7.9 x 8.1 cm (TRxAPxCC) in maximum dimensions.It has peripherally enhancing wall with thickness 2 mm. Multiple air foci are noted within thecollection.Superiorly, the collection is extending posterior to body of stomach (with mild edematousmural thickening) till the superior pole of spleen on the left and is abutting the porta hepatisand caudate lobe of liver with no evidence of hepatic parenchymal involvement on the rightside .Inferiorly, the collection is encasing most of the duodenum till the duodeno-jejunal junction.Posteriorly, it is abutting splenic vein for most of its length with its severe luminal attenuation.Posterolaterally, , it is showing linear extension along bilateral anterior pararenal fascia.Anteriorly, the collection is extending in transverse mesocolon inferior to pyloro-duodenaljunction. Antero-laterally, on right side, it is abutting surface of segment IVB and VI of liverand peritoneal surface of Gall bladder.The collection shows contiguous extension along bilateral paracolic gutters till bilateral iliac fossae. On the right side it measures ~ 24 x 9 x 6.5 cm (CC x TR x AP) and ~ 28 x 8.9 x 6.3cm (CC x TR x AP) on the left side.On contrast administration via NJ tube ��������� no evidence of contrast leak is noted. However, on contrast administration orally there is subtle leak of contrast into the right sided collection ���������likely from the duodenum. Duodenal walls appear thinned out.The IVC, aorta and bilateral common iliac and external iliac vessels are seen in close proximity to the posterior aspect of these collections. These vessels however show normal caliber and contrast opacification.Another pocket of collection is seen extending from the collection in the right paracolic gutter along the right internal iliac vessels till the presacral region.No evidence of any pancreatic calcifications noted. MPD is not dilated (maximum diameter athead ~2 mm).Moderate inflammatory changes are noted in the form of fluid and fat stranding in the peripancreatic region, along pyloro-duodenal junction and 1st, 2nd part and D2-D3 junction ofduodenum, along lesser curvature of stomach and bilateral anterior para-renal space andperinephric space, hepatic and splenic flexure, descending mesocolon and in mesentery.There is mild thickening of bilateral anterior renal fascia and bilateral lateral conal fascia.Splenic vein for a length of ~1.5 cm near porto-splenic confluence shows severe luminalattenuation with vessel wall irregularities and faint &patchy contrast opacification- likely partially thrombosed. Portal vein also shows moderate luminal attenuation near porto-splenic confluence with maintained contrast opacification. SMV also appears moderately attenuatednear the portosplenic confluence ��������� likely due to compression by the collection.outpouching.Mild free fluid is seen in pelvis and peritoneal cavity.Visualized lower segmentsof lungs show mild left sided pleural effusion of maximum thickness ~ 9 mm with patchyconsolidations noted in the superior and inferior lingular segments of the LUL. Multiple subcentimetric and few borderline enlarged mesenteric, peripancreatic and left paraaortic lymph nodes noted, largest measuring ~ 10 mm in SAD. Impression- Heterogenously enhancing pancreatic parenchyma predominantly in the distal body and tailregion (pancreatic parenchymal necrosis)- involving > 30% of pancreaticparenchyma.A relatively-defined large irregular shaped peripherally enhancing hypodense collection with multiple air foci within surrounding the entire length of the pancreas ,extending to anteriorperi-pancreatic ,subhepatic , lesser sac and till the splenic hilum regionContiguous extension of the collection pockets along bilateral pararenal, bilateral paracolicgutters till the iliac fossae and into the presacral region.Reactive inflammatory changes in the form of fat stranding , mild ascites, edematous wallthickening of stomach wall.Severe luminal attenuation with faint &patchy contrast opacification of splenic vein near porto-splenic confluence- likely partially thrombosed FIBROSCAN(06/10/25,AIIMS):CAP score-271,LSM score-12.2(ior/med-8%),CAP-Fatty liver-grade 2,LSM-Liver fibrosis-moderate.

USG W/A (10/10/25,AIIMS)-In a k/c/o of acute necrotising pancreatitis, the current USG reveals moderate left pleural effusion with underlying collapse/consolidation of a lung lobe, mild ascites, bilateral grade I renal parenchymal changes with bulky kidneys, mild

![](_page_3_Picture_0.jpeg)

![](_page_3_Picture_3.jpeg)

hepatomegaly, and GB sludge.

### OPERATION PERFORMED:

Right VARD On 17-Oct-2025

OPERATIVE FINDINGS: ultiple drains insitu in B/L flanks & lower back. Large walled off pancreatic necrosis in right retroperitoneum containing large amount of thick blackish-grayish necrotic material (sent for HPE & C/S). Loculations with pus interspersed between necrosum present. Collection seen extending towards midline and upwards towards right upper abdomen. No enteric / bilious contents/ staining noted. Drain (Foley���������s) placed through posterior route identified within the cavity

entangled and blocked by necrosum - replaced with 20 Fr Foleys. Necrosectomy and drainage done as much as safely possible. 32Fr ADK & 22Fr Foley���������s placed with the cavity.

Left VARD On 15-Oct-2025

OPERATIVE FINDINGS: Multiple drains insitu in B/L flanks & lower back. Large walled off pancreatic necrosis in left retroperitoneum containing large amount of thick blackish-grayish necrotic material (sent for HPE & C/S) with loculations with pus interspersed between necrosum. Collection seen extending upwards towards pancreas/ spleen in left upper abdomen. Drain (Foley's) placed through posterior route identified within the cavity entangled within necrosum but patent- released and repositioned. Necrosectomy and drainage done as much as safely possible. 32Fr ADK & 24Fr Foley's placed inside the cavity. Rest of the drains replaced by 24Fr Foley's catheter.

DISCHARGE BY : DR Vishal Gupta

DISCHARGE REMARKS :

CAUSE OF DEATH : Retroperitoneal Hemorrhage with Shock with MODS.

DATE OF DEATH : 06-Nov-2025

Summary Prepared By Summary Approved By

Dr Sarath Chandrabhatla DR Vishal Gupta

27/09/2025

CECT ABDOMEN
CLINICAL NOTES:
   ●C/o acute necrotizing pancreatitis (alcoholic, index pain – 07/08/2025), with infected walled
    off necrosis with anemia with left pleural effusion.
CECT Abdomen AIIMS – 16/09/2025 - Features are suggestive of Acute necrotizing pancreatitis
with infected walled off necrosis as described.Modified CTSI- 10/10 [ greater than 30% pancreatic
parenchyma involvement + WON + Splenic vein partial thrombosis].
   ●Outside CECT Abdomen – 27/08/2025 – Moderate to severe necrotizing pancreatitis with
    large peripancreatic fluid collections extending into bilateral pararenal, paracolic gutters, iliac
    fossae, greater and lesser sac; Moderate left pleural effusion with thinning of the Splenic vein
    and portal vein.
   ●LFT, RFT, Amylase, Lipase – WNL.
OBSERVATIONS:
Post procedural changes noted in the form of pigtails noted within bilateral paracolic collections.
   ●Pancreas:
   ●Pancreatic parenchyma shows heterogenous enhancement with fuzzy margins along its
    entire length, predominantly in the distal body and tail region (pancreatic parenchymal
    necrosis)- involving greater than 30% of pancreatic parenchyma.
   ❍A relatively-defined irregular shaped peripherally enhancing hypodense collection with
    multiple air foci within is noted surrounding the entire length of the pancreas ,extending to
    anterior peri-pancreatic , subhepatic , lesser sac and till the splenic hilum region with
    morphology and extent as described. It also shows extensions along bilateral pararenal,
    bilateral paracolic gutters till the iliac fossae.
   ❍It measures 21.5 x 7.9 x 8.1 cm (TRxAPxCC) in maximum dimensions.

   ❍It has peripherally enhancing wall with thickness 2 mm. Multiple air foci are noted within the
    collection.
Extent:
   ❍Superiorly, the collection is extending posterior to body of stomach (with mild edematous
    mural thickening) till the superior pole of spleen on the left and is abutting the porta hepatis
    and caudate lobe of liver with no evidence of hepatic parenchymal involvement on the right
    side .
   ❍Inferiorly, the collection is encasing most of the duodenum till the duodeno-jejunal junction.
   ❍Posteriorly, it is abutting splenic vein for most of its length with its severe luminal attenuation.
    Postero-laterally, , it is showing linear extension along bilateral anterior pararenal fascia.
   ❍Anteriorly, the collection is extending in transverse mesocolon inferior to pyloro-duodenal
    junction. Antero-laterally, on right side, it is abutting surface of segment IVB and VI of liver
    and peritoneal surface of Gall bladder.
   ❍The collection shows contiguous extension along bilateral paracolic gutters till bilateral iliac
    fossae. On the right side it measures ~ 24 x 9 x 6.5 cm (CC x TR x AP) and ~ 28 x 8.9 x 6.3
    cm (CC x TR x AP) on the left side.
   ❍On contrast administration via NJ tube – no evidence of contrast leak is noted. However, on
    contrast administration orally there is subtle leak of contrast into the right sided collection –
    likely from the duodenum. Duodenal walls appear thinned out.
   ❍The IVC, aorta and bilateral common iliac and external iliac vessels are seen in close
    proximity to the posterior aspect of these collections. These vessels however show normal
    caliber and contrast opacification.
   ❍Another pocket of collection is seen extending from the collection in the right paracolic gutter
    along the right internal iliac vessels till the presacral region.
   ❍No evidence of any pancreatic calcifications noted. MPD is not dilated (maximum diameter at
    head ~2 mm).
   ❍Moderate inflammatory changes are noted in the form of fluid and fat stranding in the
    peripancreatic region, along pyloro-duodenal junction and 1st, 2nd part and D2-D3 junction of

       duodenum, along lesser curvature of stomach and bilateral anterior para-renal space and
       perinephric space, hepatic and splenic flexure, descending mesocolon and in mesentery.
       There is mild thickening of bilateral anterior renal fascia and bilateral lateral conal fascia.
       Splenic vein for a length of ~1.5 cm near porto-splenic confluence shows severe luminal
       attenuation with vessel wall irregularities and faint &patchy contrast opacification- likely
       partially thrombosed. Portal vein also shows moderate luminal attenuation near porto-splenic
       confluence with maintained contrast opacification. SMV also appears moderately attenuated
       near the portosplenic confluence – likely due to compression by the collection. Rest of the
       portal vein ~12 mm and splenic vein ~7.5 mm show normal contrast opacification.The GDA,
       splenic artery appears normal in caliber with no evidence of any luminal at irregularity or focal
       outpouching.Mild free fluid is seen in pelvis and peritoneal cavity.Visualized lower segments
       of lungs show mild left sided pleural effusion of maximum thickness ~ 9 mm with patchy
       consolidations noted in the superior and inferior lingular segments of the LUL..
   ●   Liver- Mildly enlarged (~ 16.3 cm) Is normal in shape, attenuation &enhancement pattern.No
       IHBRD is seen. Hepatic vessels appear normal.
   ●   Gall bladder- Is distended and wall thickness is normal. No obvious hyperdense / calcified
       calculi are seen (USG is the modality of choice for GB calculi). CBD appears normal in
       caliber.
   ●   Spleen- Is normal in size, shape, attenuation &enhancement pattern.
   ●   Both kidneys are normal in size, shape and CT attenuation with normal cortical
       enhancement.PCS appears normal. No obvious hydronephrosis is seen. Both ureters are
       normal in caliber. Two subcentimetric Bosniak I simple renal cysts noted at the mid and
       lower pole of left kidney, larger at midpole measures ~ 13 x 10 mm.
   ●   Both adrenals appear normal.
   ●   Small bowel loops appear normal. IC junction appears normal. No evidence of any abnormal
       dilatation noted.
   ●   Urinary bladder- Is distended and smooth in outline. Prostate appears normal. Prostatic
       calcifications noted.

# FLUID CYTOLOGY REPORT

# Fluid Cytology ID:C-3117/25: Pleural fluid.

Received 10 ml pale yellow, clear pleural fluid for cytology.

Clinical Diagnosis: Acute necrotizing pancreatitis with pleural effusion under evaluation

Cell Count:

Total Leucocyte Count: 43 cells/cumm.

Differential Leukocyte Count:

Lymphomononuclear cells: 39 cells/cumm Polymorphonuclear cells: 04 cells/cumm

## Microscopic findings:

Centrifuged smears examined are paucicellular showing scattered inflammatory cells comprising of predominantly lymphocytes admixed with rare neutrophils in a proteinacous backgound. No atypical/malignant cells are seen in the smears examined.

Impression: Pleural fluid: Descriptive; See text.

Advice: Clinical correlation.

Dr. Shanmugapriya Dr. Sramana Mukhopadhyay Senior Resident Additional Professor

**\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* END OF THE REPORT \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***

# Histopathology

# S-11099/25

Nature of Specimen: Debrided tissue from retroperitoneum.

Clinical Diagnosis: Known case of acute necrotizing pancreatitis with infected walled off necrosis.

Gross Examination: Received multiple grey brown soft tissue pieces altogether measuring

6x5x4cm. Representative sections in A and B.

### Microscopic Examination:

Sections examined show large areas of hemorrhage and necrotic tissue along with presence of vegetative matter. No viable tissue identified.

Impression: Debrided tissue from retroperitoneum: Descriptive; See text.

# Histopathology

# S-11040/25

Nature of Specimen: Debrided tissue from retroperitoneum.

Clinical Diagnosis: Case of acute necrotizing pancreatitis with infected walled off necrosis with sepsis.

Gross Examination: Received multiple grey brown soft tissue pieces altogether measuring 4x3x2cm. Representative sections in A and B.

### Microscopic Examination:

Section examined shows large areas of hemorrhage and necrosis. The intervening fibrocollagenous tissue shows mild inflammatory infiltrate comprising of lymphocytes and neutrophils. No viable tissue is identified.

PAS stain: Negative for fungal element.

Impression: Debrided tissue from retroperitoneum: Acute Necrotizing Inflammation.

Advice: Clinical correlation.

Dr Shivanee Joshi Dr Hemlata Panwar Senior Resident Additional Professor **\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* END OF THE REPORT \*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\***

**All reports need clinical correlation. Kindly discuss if necessary. No part of the report can be reproduced without written permission of the department.**

# Patient Proforma
## Department of Surgical Gastroenterology, AIIMS Bhopal
### Thesis Title: 'Analysis of Splanchnic Venous Thrombosis in Acute Pancreatitis: A Prospective Observational Study'

---

**Assessment Type:** Final assessment (Deceased)
**Date:** 15-January-2026
**Study ID:** `AP-SVT-005`

---

## 1. Demographics

| Field | Details |
|-------|---------|
| **Name** | [REDACTED_NAME] |
| **Age / Sex** | 35 years / Male |
| **CR No.** | [REDACTED_CR] |
| **Contact No.** | Data not available |
| **Address** | [REDACTED_ADDRESS] |
| **OPD/IPD** | IPD - Medical ICU |
| **Occupation** | Data not available |
| **Date of Admission** | 12-September-2025 |
| **Date of Death** | 06-November-2025 |
| **Weight / Height** | 55.5 kg / 172 cm |
| **BMI** | 18.8 kg/m² |
| **ASA Classification** | Data not available |

### Addictions

| Substance | Duration |
|-----------|----------|
| Alcohol | 5 years (acute episode after alcohol) |
| Smoking | 8 years |
| Tobacco chewing | 8 years |
| Others | None documented |

---

## 2. Clinical Details

### A. Pain in Abdomen

| Parameter | Details |
|-----------|---------|
| **Index pain** | 05-August-2025 (sudden onset severe pain after alcohol) |
| **Current pain** | 4 months duration at presentation |
| **Duration** | Acute onset, chronic course |
| **Site** | Epigastric |
| **Severity (VAS 1-10)** | Severe |

### B. Other Features

| Feature | Present | Duration/Details |
|---------|---------|------------------|
| Vomiting | [x] Yes | 4 months |
| Fever | [x] Yes | High-grade |
| Abdominal distension | [ ] No | - |
| Jaundice | [ ] No | - |
| Chest Pain | [ ] No | - |
| Dyspnoea | [x] Yes | Required ventilation |
| Hematemesis | [ ] No | - |
| Melena/Haematochezia | [ ] No | - |
| Ascites | [x] Yes | Moderate (at death) |
| Splenomegaly | [ ] No | Not mentioned |

---

## 3. Comorbidities

| Comorbidity | Present | Duration |
|-------------|---------|----------|
| DM | [ ] No | - |
| HTN | [ ] No | - |
| CAD | [ ] No | - |
| Obesity | [ ] No | BMI 18.8 |
| COPD | [ ] No | - |
| CLD | [x] Yes | History of liver disease (6 months on medication) |
| Thyroid disorder | [ ] No | - |
| Known Coagulopathy Disorder | [ ] No | - |
| Fatty Liver | [x] Yes | Grade 2 with moderate fibrosis (FibroScan: CAP 271, LSM 12.2) |

---

## 4. Etiology of Acute Pancreatitis

**Etiology:** Alcohol (5-year history, acute episode triggered after alcohol intake)

---

## 5. Acute Pancreatitis

### Severity Score

| Parameter | Value |
|-----------|-------|
| **Revised Atlanta Severity Grade** | [x] Severe (necrotizing with >30% necrosis, MODS, infected collections) |
| **Modified CT Severity Score** | 10/10 (Maximum severity) |

### Acute Pancreatitis Type

- [ ] Edematous (Interstitial)
- [x] Necrotizing (>30% necrosis, emphysematous)

### Complications

#### GIT Complications
- [ ] Perforation (duodenal leak)
- [ ] Intestinal obstruction
- [ ] Gastric outlet obstruction
- [ ] Fistula
- [ ] Ischemia
- [ ] Bleeding
- [x] Other: **Contained duodenal leak from D3**, **NJ tube erosion/perforation of distal duodenum**

#### Vascular - Splanchnic

**Arterial - Pseudoaneurysm:** [ ] No

**Venous - Thrombosis:** [x] Yes

- [x] Splenic Vein - PARTIAL THROMBOSIS (1.5-1.7 cm segment)
- [x] Portal Vein - PARTIAL THROMBOSIS (moderate luminal attenuation)
- [ ] Superior Mesenteric Vein (compressed but patent)
- [x] Combined (PV + SV partial)

**Septicemia / Organ Failure:** [x] Yes - Multiple organ failure
- Respiratory (pleural effusion, required prolonged ventilation + tracheostomy)
- Renal (anuria terminally)
- Cardiovascular (shock requiring dual ionotropes)
- Hepatic (sepsis-induced liver dysfunction)

**Pancreatic Necrosis:** [x] Yes - >30% necrosis, emphysematous infected collections

---

## 6. Investigations

### A. Laboratory Investigations

| Test | Values |
|------|--------|
| **Haemoglobin (g/dL)** | Data in Hematology.pdf |
| **Total Leukocyte Count (K/µL)** | Data in Hematology.pdf |
| **Platelet (K/µL)** | Data in Hematology.pdf |
| **C-Reactive Protein (mg/L)** | Not available |
| **Bilirubin Total (mg/dL)** | Data in Biochemistry.pdf |
| **AST (U/L)** | Data in Biochemistry.pdf |
| **ALT (U/L)** | Data in Biochemistry.pdf |
| **PT/INR** | Data in Coagulation.pdf |
| **Serum Amylase (U/L)** | Data in Biochemistry.pdf |
| **Serum Lipase (U/L)** | Data in Biochemistry.pdf |
| **FibroScan (06-Oct-2025)** | CAP 271 (Fatty liver Gr 2), LSM 12.2 (Moderate fibrosis) |

### B. Imaging / Endoscopy

| Imaging | Date | Key Findings |
|---------|------|--------------|
| **CECT Abdomen (Outside)** | 28-Aug-2025 | Moderate-severe pancreatitis (CT score 8), collections 9×10cm right, 8×10cm left |
| **CECT Abdomen (AIIMS)** | 16-Sep-2025 | >30% necrosis, emphysematous collections, **PARTIAL SVT** |
| **CECT Abdomen (AIIMS)** | 27-Sep-2025 | WON 21.5×7.9×8.1cm, **duodenal leak from D3**, **SVT confirmed** |
| **CECT Abdomen (AIIMS)** | 01-Oct-2025 | Contrast leak from D3 duodenum (contained) |
| **CECT Abdomen (AIIMS)** | 03-Nov-2025 | NJ tube perforation of duodenum, pancreas atrophied, **PV/SV thrombosis** |
| **FibroScan** | 06-Oct-2025 | Fatty liver Grade 2, Moderate fibrosis |

### C. Endoscopy

| Procedure | Date | Findings |
|-----------|------|----------|
| **UGIE** | Not done | - |

---

## Overall Imaging Findings

| # | Parameter | Finding/Details |
|---|-----------|-----------------|
| 1 | **Pancreas** | [x] Necrosis (>30%), atrophied terminally |
| - | Necrosis location | Diffuse (head, body, tail) |
| - | Necrosis (%) | >30% |
| 2 | **Necrosis site** | [x] Both (Pancreatic + Extra-pancreatic) |
| 3 | **Peripancreatic fluid collection** | [x] Yes - Extensive |
| 4 | **Pancreatic Fluid Collection** | Giant WON 21.5×7.9×8.1 cm |
| 5 | **Walled-off necrosis** | [x] Yes - Emphysematous/infected |
| 6 | **Modified CTSI** | 10/10 (Maximum) |
| 7 | **Splanchnic vein thrombosis** | [x] **YES - PV + SV (PARTIAL)** |

### Splanchnic Venous Assessment

| Vessel | Status | Details |
|--------|--------|---------|
| **Portal Vein (PV)** | [x] **PARTIAL THROMBOSIS** | Moderate luminal attenuation, maintained contrast opacification |
| - Extent | Partial | - |
| - Location | Near porto-splenic confluence | - |
| - Cavernous transformation | [ ] No | - |
| **Superior Mesenteric Vein (SMV)** | [x] Patent but compressed | Moderately attenuated due to external compression |
| - Extent | Compression | - |
| - Location | Near confluence | - |
| - Branch involvement | [ ] No | - |
| **Splenic Vein (SV)** | [x] **PARTIAL THROMBOSIS** | Severe luminal attenuation (1.5-1.7 cm segment), vessel wall irregularities, faint contrast |
| - Extent | Partial (1.5-1.7 cm) | - |
| - Location | Near porto-splenic confluence | - |
| - Isolated SV thrombosis | [ ] No | Combined with PV |
| **SMV-SV Confluence** | [x] Partially blocked | Thrombosis and compression |

### Portal Hypertensive Changes

| Finding | Present | Details |
|---------|---------|---------|
| Splenomegaly | [ ] No | Not mentioned |
| Ascites | [x] Yes | Moderate (at death) |
| Varices | [?] Unknown | UGIE not done |
| Collaterals | [x] Yes | Near splenic hilum |
| Portal Gastropathy | [?] Unknown | Not evaluated |
| Others | [x] Yes | Peri-portal edema, prominent intrahepatic biliary radicles |

### Vascular Complications

| Complication | Present | Details |
|--------------|---------|---------|
| Arterial pseudoaneurysm | [ ] No | - |
| Intra-abdominal bleeding | [x] **FATAL** | **Retroperitoneal hemorrhage from peridrain sites** |
| Bowel ischemia | [ ] No | - |
| Splenic infarction | [ ] No | - |

### Other Findings

| Finding | Present | Details |
|---------|---------|---------|
| Gall stones | [x] Yes | GB sludge present |
| CBD | Prominent | Intrahepatic biliary radicles prominent |
| GI complications | [x] Yes | Contained duodenal leak (D3), NJ tube erosion/perforation |
| Pleural effusion | [x] Yes | Required treatment |
| Fatty liver | [x] Yes | Grade 2 with moderate fibrosis |

---

## 7. Management

### Conservative

- [x] ICU admission (MICU from 16-Oct-2025)
- [x] Parenteral nutrition (NJ feeding)
- [x] Ionotropic support (dual support terminally)
- [x] Ventilator support (prolonged, tracheostomy done)
- [ ] Hemodialysis / CRRT
- [x] Other: Tracheostomy, multiple blood products

### Intervention

- [x] Yes

### Interventions Summary

| Intervention | Date | Indication | Outcome |
|--------------|------|------------|---------|
| Aspiration x2 (Outside) | Aug-2025 | Fluid collections | Temporary relief |
| Bilateral PCD placement | 16-Sep-2025 | Emphysematous collections | Drained 100-150ml pus daily |
| 2 additional PCDs | 30-Sep-2025 | Bilateral collections | Developed enteric output |
| **Left VARD necrosectomy** | 15-Oct-2025 | WON left retroperitoneum | Extensive necrosis removed |
| **Right VARD necrosectomy** | 17-Oct-2025 | WON right retroperitoneum | Extensive necrosis removed |
| Tracheostomy | Oct-2025 | Prolonged ventilation | Performed |

### Anticoagulation Therapy

- [x] **No - NOT STARTED despite PV and SV thrombosis**

**Rationale for no anticoagulation:** High bleeding risk (developed fatal hemorrhage)

---

## 8. Outcomes

### Duration of Stay

| Parameter | Days |
|-----------|------|
| **ICU stay** | ~21 days (from 16-Oct to death on 06-Nov) |
| **Total hospital stay** | 55 days |

### Morbidity

1. **Organ failure:** [x] Yes - **MULTIPLE ORGAN FAILURE (MODS)**
   - Respiratory failure (required prolonged ventilation + tracheostomy)
   - Cardiovascular failure (shock requiring dual ionotropes)
   - Renal failure (anuria terminally)
   - Hepatic dysfunction (sepsis-induced)

2. **Bowel ischemia:** [ ] No

3. **Bleeding:** [x] **FATAL RETROPERITONEAL HEMORRHAGE**

4. **Variceal bleeding:** [ ] No (0 episodes)

5. **Splenic infarction:** [ ] No

6. **Bleeding on anticoagulation:** N/A (not on anticoagulation)

7. **Readmission:** N/A (continuous admission)

### Mortality

- [x] **YES - DECEASED (06-November-2025 at 12:01 PM)**

---

## CAUSE OF DEATH

**Immediate Cause:** Retroperitoneal Hemorrhage with Shock and Multi-Organ Dysfunction Syndrome (MODS)

### Terminal Sequence of Events (06-Nov-2025):
1. 01:30 AM - Acute bleeding from peridrain sites
2. Hypotension requiring dual ionotropes
3. Emergency transfusion (4 FFP, 1 PRBC)
4. Severe metabolic acidosis
5. Anuria
6. 11:30 AM - Ventricular tachyarrhythmia
7. 3 cycles of CPR per ACLS protocol
8. 12:01 PM - Declared dead

### Contributing Factors:
- Severe necrotizing pancreatitis (>30% necrosis, CTSI 10/10)
- Splanchnic venous thrombosis (PV + SV partial)
- Sepsis with hepatic dysfunction
- Duodenal leak and NJ tube erosion
- 55 days of critical illness

---

## 9. Follow-up

### Splanchnic Venous Thrombosis Assessment

**COMBINED PV + SV PARTIAL THROMBOSIS - PROGRESSIVE**

| Parameter | 16-Sep-2025 | 27-Sep-2025 | 03-Nov-2025 |
|-----------|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| Splenic Vein | Partial SVT | SVT confirmed | PV/SV thrombosis |
| Portal Vein | Moderate attenuation | - | Thrombosed |
| SMV | Compressed | - | - |
| Progression | - | Worsened | Worsened |
| Recanalization | - | No | No |

### Last Assessment Date

- **Date:** 03-November-2025 (last CECT)
- **Duration since disease onset:** ~3 months
- **Status:** DECEASED (06-Nov-2025)

---

## 10. Status at Death (06-Nov-2025)

| Parameter | Status |
|-----------|--------|
| **Vascular Status** | [x] PV + SV THROMBOSED (partial, progressive) |
| **Anticoagulation** | NEVER started |
| **Portal Hypertension** | [x] Developed (collaterals, ascites) |
| - Splenomegaly | Unknown |
| - Collaterals/Cavernoma | Present near splenic hilum |
| - Esophagogastric varices | Not evaluated |
| - Portal Gastropathy | Not evaluated |

### Major Complications Leading to Death

- **Fatal retroperitoneal hemorrhage from peridrain sites**
- Sepsis with MODS (respiratory, cardiovascular, renal, hepatic)
- Severe necrotizing pancreatitis (>30% necrosis)
- Emphysematous infected collections
- Contained duodenal leak (D3)
- NJ tube perforation of duodenum
- Splanchnic venous thrombosis (PV + SV)
- 55 days of critical illness

---

## Histopathology Findings

**Necrosectomy Specimens (15-Oct and 17-Oct-2025):**
- Extensive hemorrhage and necrosis
- Acute necrotizing inflammation
- No viable tissue identified
- PAS stain negative for fungal elements
- Presence of vegetative matter in right-sided specimen

---

## Summary

**Study ID:** AP-SVT-005

**Classification:** **SVT CASE - COMBINED PV + SV PARTIAL THROMBOSIS (DECEASED)**

**Key Points:**
1. 35-year-old male with severe acute necrotizing pancreatitis (CTSI 10/10)
2. Etiology: Alcohol (5-year history)
3. **COMBINED PV + SV THROMBOSIS - PARTIAL, PROGRESSIVE**
   - First documented: 16-Sep-2025
   - Progression: Worsened over time
   - Never recanalized
4. SMV: Compressed but patent
5. Portal hypertensive changes developed:
   - Collaterals near splenic hilum
   - Moderate ascites
   - Peri-portal edema
6. Complicated by:
   - **>30% pancreatic necrosis (CTSI 10/10)**
   - **Emphysematous infected collections**
   - **Contained duodenal leak (D3)**
   - **NJ tube perforation of duodenum**
   - **Multiple organ failure (respiratory, cardiovascular, renal, hepatic)**
   - **Bilateral VARD necrosectomy performed**
   - **Fatty liver with moderate fibrosis**
7. **ANTICOAGULATION NEVER STARTED** (high bleeding risk)
8. **FATAL OUTCOME: Retroperitoneal hemorrhage**
9. Total hospital stay: 55 days
10. **DECEASED: 06-November-2025**

**CRITICAL RESEARCH NOTES:**
1. **Fatal case** despite maximum medical and surgical management
2. **Bilateral VARD necrosectomy** performed but patient deteriorated
3. **Progressive SVT** - worsened from partial to more extensive
4. **NO anticoagulation** - likely appropriate given fatal hemorrhage
5. **GI complications** (duodenal leak, NJ perforation) contributed to death
6. **Maximum CTSI score (10/10)** - predictor of poor outcome
7. **Young patient (35 years)** with severe disease and mortality
8. **Retroperitoneal hemorrhage** as terminal event - NOT variceal bleeding

---

**Data Collection Date:** 15-January-2026
**Data Collected By:** Dr Sarath Chandrabhatla
**Last Updated:** 15-January-2026
**Patient Status:** DECEASED (06-Nov-2025)
