                                              Department : Surgical Gastroenterology
                                                         Discharge Summary

CR No.: 239212501867763                Name: Vipin Narware                                        Age/Gender: 34 Yr/M

Admission No.: 239212025052582         Department Unit: Surgical Gastroenterology (Surgical       Consultant/Faculty: Dr Vishal Gupta
                                       Gastroenterology)

Ward: Gastro Surgery Ward              Room/Bed: Gastro Srg Ward Room/ Bed 5                      Patient Category: B P L

 Discharge Type: Normal Discharge      Father/Spouse Name: Namdeo Narware/Sarita Narware          Occupation:

Contact No.: 6263008776                Address: D,,X,Betul                                        State/Country Madhya
                                                                                                  Pradesh/India

D.O.A. : 28-Aug-2025 16:44             D.O.D. : 05-Sep-2025                                       D.O. Print Report: 05-Sep-2025 14:14

CHIEF COMPLAINTS:
Abdominal pain x 3 months on & off
Fever x 3 days
Cough with expectation x 3 days
Pus discharge from PCD site x 1 day
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Patient was apparently alright 3 months back , when he developed abdominal pain in upper
abdomen, sudden in onset, progressive in nature, not relieved with medications. Patient consulted elsewhere for these complaints,
evaluated with imaging. Patient then consulted in TEM, AIIMS Bhopal, where he was admitted & evaluated & managed conservatively
and discharged. From there on patient has been having abdominal pain on & off, for which patient consulted in SGE OPD and was
managed conservatively and was kept on follow up. But patient had persistent abdominal, hence patient was advised to consult in
VIR where PCD was placed into the collection on 08/05/25. Initially PCD output was around 100-200 ml Pus per day, which started
reducing gradually. Patient again consulted in VIR for assessment and PCD was removed on 19/08/25 in view of no obvious collection.
Now for the past 3 days patient has been having fever & cough f/b pus discharge from PCD site since yesterday, so that now came to
SGE OPD and admitted in SGE ward for further management. Not a k/c/o DM/HTN/TB/BA/CAD. He takes mixed diet, no sleep
disturbance, normal bowel & bladder habits. History of alcohol consumption for last 8-10 years, stopped 3-4 months ago. No known
medical comorbidities & surgical history. No significant family history or drug history.
CASE SUMMARY: Patient was conscious, oriented, moderately buit and nourished. GC fair.
Mild Pallor+, No Icterus/Edema/LN
HR-95bpm, BP-100/70mmHg, RR-20/min, Spo2-98%, Afebrile.
Weight-49.3 kg, Height-170cm, BMI-17.2Kg/m2.
P/A-Soft, Epigastric tenderness+, not distended, PCD site pus discharge+, no organomegaly, vague lump + over Epigastric region, no
ascites, no scars.
CONDITION AT DISCHARGE: Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating orals, passing flatus and
motion, abdomen soft, non tender, stoma bag over drain site- minimal output and hence being discharged in stable condition.
FINAL DIAGNOSIS:
Acute necrotizing pancreatitis
Remarks: Ethanol related


walled off necrosis (infected)




                                                                                                                             Page No: 1

                                                                                            CR: 239212501867763




S/P PCD (08/08/2025 to 19/08/2025)


Anemia


Mild ascites


HOSPITAL COURSE: Patient was admitted in SGE ward for above mentioned complaints. Necessary blood investigations were done (
Hb-8,TLC-11450, Plt-3.48L, Urea/Creat-36/1.5, Na/K-136/4.8, TB/DB-1/0.4, AST/ALT-77/18, ALP/GGT-118/73, TP/Alb-6.9/2.3,PT/INR-
16/1).He had cough with expectoration, Pulmonary medicine consulted for cough with expectoration advise followed. Xray chest -
normal. Sputum expectorant for c/s- inappropriate. Pus sent from PCD site for c/s came sterile. DFA- 7342. Stoma bad placed over
removed pcd site (amount- minimal , pus). VIR Consultation sought revealed no obvious collection identified, advised further follow
up. CECT abdomen planned to look for intra abdominal collections dated on 20/09/25. USG w/a on 03/09/25 revealed minimal to
mild ascites. Fungal c/s report pending. During hospital course, patient managed with IVF, iv antibiotics(Levofloxacin,
metronidazole),iv PPI, iv analgesics, Iv antiemetics, antihistaminics, and other symptomatic & supportive care. Labs on discharge: Hb
7.3,TLC-6510, Plt-3.2L, Urea/creat- 31/1, Na/K-131/4.5. Currently patient is hemodynamically stable, ambulatory, afebrile, tolerating
orals, passing flatus and motion, abdomen soft, non tender, stoma bag over drain site- minimal output and hence being discharged
in stable condition.
OTHER INVESTIGATIONS: USG WHOLE ABDOMEN WITH DOPPLER (31.07.2025,OUTSIDE): PANCREAS: Large heterogeneous
hypoechoic collection (measures 9.0X5.8 cm) with moving internal echoes is seen in pancreatic region replacing most of the
pancreatic parenchyma. Mild to moderate surrounding inflammation is seen. LIVER: Liver is normal in size (measures 12.8 cm), shape
and echogenicity. No focal lesion is seen. No intra hepatic biliary radical dilation seen. Hepatic vessels appear normal. main portal
vein and its intra hepatic branches are normal. portal vein shows a normal in caliber, measures 11.2 mm at the porta. No intraluminal
thrombus seen.
The main splenic vein is normal in caliber (measures upto 4.5 mm) at the hilum and appears normal. No intraluminal thrombus seen.
Normal hepatopetal flow was noted in the SV, SMV and the main portal vein. The spectral trace is normal. There is no evidence of any
collaterals seen at the splenic hilum, peripancreatic region or at the porta hepatic to suggest portal hypertension. SPLEEN: Spleen is
normal in size (measures 9.4 cm) and echotexture. No focal lesion is noted. CBD is normal in size. No calculus is noted. GALL
BLADDER: Gall bladder is distended. Wall thickness is normal. No pericholecystic fluid noted. No calculus seen. Mild free fluid is seen
in the pelvic cavity. IMPRESSION: Follow up case of acute necrotizing pancreatitis USG WHOLE ABDOMEN WITH DOPPLER REVEALS -
Large heterogeneous hypoechoic collection with moving internal echoes in pancreatic region replacing most of the pancreatic
parenchyma. Mild to moderate surrounding inflammation-likely acute necrotizing pancreatitis with necrotizing collection. Normal
colour Doppler study of the porto-splenic venous system. No evidence of intraluminal thrombus seen. Mild ascites.
USG in AIIMS on 2/7/25 - Pancreas mildly bulky with ill defined heterogeneously hypoechoic collection of size 9 x 7.5 x 3 cm noted in
pancreatic head region with internal septation - s/o pancreatitis with peripancreatic collection. GB - Normal, echofree


CECT ABDOMEN (04/07/2025, AIIMS): Pancreas: there is non-visualization of most of the head and body of pancreas (greater than
30%) which is replaced by an ill-defined collection. The visualized parts of body and uncinate process shows heterogenous
enhancement.Main pancreatic duct: not dilated.
Calcifications: Absent. Fat stranding: Diffuse peripancreatic fat stranding noted associated with fat stranding around stomach and D1
and D2 segment of duodenum. Peripancreatic collection: An ill-defined hypodense thick-walled collection noted in the pancreatic
head, body and tail region replacing the pancreatic parenchyma extending into the lesser sac and further laterally into the
supramesocolic space abutting the right abdominal wall muscles (at right lumbar region) measuring 6.4x19.5x7.7cm (APXTRXCC) with
fat attenuating foci within - suggestive of acute necrotic collection. It is communicating with another collection in the transverse




                                                                                                                                 Page No: 2

                                                                                              CR: 239212501867763




mesocolon measuring ~ 4.5x8.1x9.2cm. There is significant perigastric fat stranding and edematous duodenal loops with
surrounding fat stranding noted along left anterior and posterior pararenal fascia and along conal fascia.Ascites: Gross amount of
free fluid is noted in the perihepatic, pericholecystic, periportal, perisplenic region, bilateral paracolic gutters, interbowel region and
pelvic cavity. fluid is noted in the left pleural cavity of maximum thickness ~ 4.2cm with collapse/consolidation of the overlying
lung.Few sub centimetric homogenously enhancing mesenteric and peripancreatic lymph nodes are noted, of average size - 4 mm
with associated mesenteric fat stranding noted.Vessels:Splenic vein: appears mildly attenuated in caliber at the proximal 1/3rd.
However, no evidence of any intraluminal filling defect is noted. Portal vein/SMV/SA: appears patent with no evidence of thrombosis.
Gastro-duodenal artery: appears normal with no e/o aneurysrnal dilatation is noted. Right hepatic artery shows origin from the SMA
supplying the right lobe of liver- replaced right hepatic artery. No obvious leak of contrast noted from any of the above described
vessels. Liver - is normal in size, shape, attenuation &enhancement pattern. No IHBRD is seen. Hepatic vessels appear normal. Portal
vein is normal. Transient hepatic attenuation differences are noted in the segment V, VII and VIII. Gall bladder - Is distended and wall
thickness is normal. No obvious hyperdense / calcified calculi are seen (USG is the modality of choice for GB calculi)). CBD appears
normal in caliber.Spleen- is normal in size, shape, attenuation &enhancement pattern. No obvious focal /diffuse pathology is seen.
Impression: Acute necrotizing pancreatitis with acute necrotic collection - CTSI 10/10. Gross ascites with diffuse mesenteric fat
stranding. Moderate left pleural effusion


USG W/A(03/09/25) LIVER- Normal, shape, size& echotexture, no IHBRD, PV-normal, hepatopetal flow, Hepatic veins & intrahepatic
IVC normal. GB-normal, shape, size , echofree. SPLEEN- normal, shape, size & echotexture. CBD-proximal,non-dilated.PANCREAS-
obscurred.Both KIDNEYS-normal. U.B.- Partially filled, prostate-normal. Minimal to mild free fluid in peritoneal cavity. Visualized
bowel loops are unremarkable. IMPRESSION: minimal to Mild ascites.
ADVICE ON DISCHARGE:
Normal diet (low fat/high protein)
Strict abstinence of alcohol
Tab Levofloxacin 500 mg 1 OD x 5 days
Tab Paracetamol 500mg TDS X 5 days
Tab Montelukast+ Levocetrizine 1 Hs x 5 days
Tab Iron+folic acid 1 OD X 14 days
Syp Multivitamin 10ml OD X 14 days
Syp Lactulose 20ml HS
CECT Abdomen scheduled on 20/09/2025
Stoma care & output charting 24 hrly.
Review in SGE OPD (Pancreas clinic) on Thursday
DISCHARGE BY : Dr Vishal Gupta
DISCHARGE REMARKS :
FOLLOW UP ON : 11-Sep-2025
FOLLOW UP CONSULTANT / FACULTY : Dr Vishal Gupta
FOLLOW UP ADVICE : Review in TEM, AIIMS Bhopal/nearby hospital in case of fever/pain/cough/vomiting etc
Hematology OPD consultation for anemia
Summary Prepared By                                                   Summary Approved By

Dr Gourav Singh Rajput                                                Dr Vishal Gupta
